barchart.semantic: Our barchart has inputs for bars and size. Bars either a date, number or string, defining the X-axis. Size is a number defining the Y-axis, and can be the average, count, count unique, max, min, sum, median, csv or csv unique. Both 'bars' and 'size' can only have one input.

geomap.semantic: Our geomap has inputs for country and size. Country is a string representation of a country. Size is a representation of the value, and can be the average, count, count unique, max, min, sum, median, csv or csv unique.

linechart.semantic: Our linechart has inputs for X Axis, Y Axis and Lines. X Axis and Y Axis are either a number or date, defining the X and Y axis. Lines is a number, date or string, defining the lines on the chart by for example grouping the data points in a category.

sankey.semantic: Our sankey has inputs for steps and size. Steps is an ordered list of: a number, date or string, defining the steps in the sankey. Size is a number defining the size of the steps, and can be the average, count, count unique, max, min, sum, median, csv or csv unique.

treemap.semantic: Our treemap has inputs for hierarchy and size. Hierarchy is an ordered list of: a number, date or string, defining the blocks in the treemap. Size is a number defining the size of the hierarchy blocks, and can be the average, count, count unique, max, min, sum, median, csv or csv unique.

areastack.semantic: Our areastack has inputs for X Axis, Y Axis and Lines. X Axis and Y Axis are either a number or date, defining the X and Y axis. Lines is a number, date or string, defining the lines on the chart by for example grouping the data points in a category.

sunburst.semantic: Our sunburst has inputs for hierarchy and size. Hierarchy is an ordered list of: a number, date or string, defining the blocks in the sunburst. Size is a number defining the size of the hierarchy blocks, and can be the average, count, count unique, max, min, sum, median, csv or csv unique.

piechart.semantic: Our piechart has inputs for arcs. Arcs is a number defining the size of the arcs, and can be the average, count, count unique, max, min, sum, median, csv or csv unique.

circlepacking.semantic: Our circlepacking has inputs for hierarchy and size. Hierarchy is an ordered list of: a number, date or string, defining the blocks in the circlepacking. Size is a number defining the size of the hierarchy blocks, and can be the average, count, count unique, max, min, sum, median, csv or csv unique.

circulargraph.semantic: Our circulargraph has inputs for categories and size. Categories is an ordered list of: a number, date or string, defining the categories in the circulargraph. Size is a number defining the size of the categories, and can be the average, count, count unique, max, min, sum, median, csv or csv unique.

forcegraph.semantic: Our forcegraph has inputs for categories and size. Categories is an ordered list of: a number, date or string, defining the categories in the forcegraph. Size is a number defining the size of the categories, and can be the average, count, count unique, max, min, sum, median, csv or csv unique.

bubblechart.semantic: Our bubblechart has inputs for X Axis, Y Axis, Size, Color and Label. X Axis and Y Axis are either a number or date, defining the X and Y axis. Size is a number defining the size of the bubbles. Color is a number, date or string, defining the color of the bubbles. Label is a number, date or string, defining the label of the bubbles.

heatmap.semantic: Our heatmap has inputs for X Axis, Y Axis and Size. X Axis and Y Axis are either a number or date, defining the X and Y axis. Size is a number defining the size of the heatmap blocks, and can be the average, count, count unique, max, min, sum, median, csv or csv unique.

radarchart.semantic: Our radarchart has inputs for spokes and color. Spokes is a number defining the spokes of the radarchart. Color is a number, date or string, defining the color of the spokes.

graphgl.semantic: Our graphgl has inputs for categories and size. Categories is an ordered list of: a number, date or string, defining the categories in the graphgl. Size is a number defining the size of the categories, and can be the average, count, count unique, max, min, sum, median, csv or csv unique.

areatimeaxis.semantic: Our areatimeaxis has inputs for X Axis and Y Axis. X Axis is a date, defining the X axis. Y Axis is either a number or date, defining the Y axis.

scatterchart.semantic: Our scatterchart has inputs for X Axis and Y Axis. X Axis and Y Axis are either a number or date, defining the X and Y axis.
